tweets.text: It's so sad to see the canal you love polluted by oil and diesel. Watching helplessly as ducks and geese struggle through the slime. It's been like this for five days, worsening, and the cause hasn't been found. #Retweet #PeakForestCanal @BBCNWT @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency https://t.co/oKzQsGztFK

Fountains of sewage spurting from access chambers on Clifton Ings SSSI today. A regular occurrence when river levels are high, as has been pointed out many, many times to @EnvAgencyYNE, @NEYorksNLincs, @YorkshireWater. 
This is discharge pipe from Rawcliffe STW to River Ouse. https://t.co/2fWesgc9ow
@EnvAgency when will you ever resolve this @hexhamcourant https://t.co/VosgFMbIGt

tweets.text: @wonky_eggs @EnvAgencyYNE @NEYorksNLincs @YorkshireWater Sometimes the fountains are a metre high! Right next to a well used footpath as well. It's treated sewage but still laden with nutrients of course.  As for @YorkshireWater, they can hardly plead poverty: https://t.co/j8JobgtvOB

Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa

Powerful statement by Sir J Bevan @EnvAgency  "Much higher sea levels will take out most of the world’s cities, displace millions & make much of the rest of our land surface uninhabitable or unusable" Must not be ignored @KwasiKwarteng #SayNo2SizewellC 

https://t.co/D0mue7Gnw7

tweets.text: @Plasmadreamer @EnvAgencyYNE @NEYorksNLincs @YorkshireWater Nutrient pollution is a major threat to this type of grassland & as far as I know there is no phosphate removal from this treatment works: certainly the access chambers are surrounded by big stands of nettles which grow larger by the year and clearly indicate nutrient pollution.

Why does the waste sector perform so poorly in H&S? Why are so many waste business a mess and a nuisance to neighbours? Why so many fires? Because investment is strangled by competing with criminals. Ok for the big boys with EfW’s and council work, not the smaller independents. https://t.co/cT5009Rv3R

We’ve also developed options to manage flood risk in Ruislip at Park Wood & Pinn Meadows. Here's the latest info on the project at our webpage: https://t.co/k82gkGP9Q7

If you've any questions about the scheme, please email the project team: RuislipPWPM@environment-agency.gov.uk https://t.co/Kb6BIq4jMy

@EnvAgency have you had reports of oil in the #Thames at #Windsor? One of our team is there and says the Swans’ bellies are blackened and it’s all along the river bank from the Hurricane statue on Barry Avenue to French Brothers’ boats. Swan Support are on the spot already. https://t.co/H7EknBXrTP

tweets.text:
We're restoring an 800m stretch of the river Cray in #Bexley to help it flow more naturally & help plants, fish & birds to thrive, in partnership with @EnovertCT @LBofBexley & @EnvAgency 💧
Read about the positive impact the works will have here 👉
https://t.co/EyyUOjZ3Fl https://t.co/m0VIlriIZs

urls.title: Precious chalk stream in Bexley gets health boost - Thames21
urls.description: Bexley residents and local wildlife can now enjoy a healthier river Cray where it flows through Foots Cray Meadows, Bexley.Waterways charity Thames21 has carried out restoration work on an 800m stretch of the river

The Great North Bog! Details of an ambitious plan to restore England’s peatlands and shore up what is a huge carbon sink, in today’s Sunday Times.

https://t.co/hEtiTFcVto

@whiterosegreen @EnvAgencyYNE @NEYorksNLincs @YorkshireWater Final effluent is fully treated, it’s not ‘sewage’ so not ‘really’ a problem. Hydraulically it looks like the outfall is submerged due to high river levels and the outfall pipe is backed up and surcharging through the covers. YW could replace with watertight  out down covers?
#pollution #sewage urgent action needed @YorkshireWater @EnvAgency ... https://t.co/whss3GSYFK

Work on a major project with @abports21 will start this spring to realign existing #flood embankments and create approx. 175 hectares of new mudflat and saltmarsh habitats on the north bank of the #Humber estuary, near #Skeffling. 
https://t.co/iskG0sCrPO https://t.co/2zdN0U9JvA

urls.title: Major habitat creation project on the Humber to start this spring
urls.description: The Environment Agency and Associated British Ports to start work to create 175 hectares of new habitat.

tweets.text:
Last week our Rivers Team @LYR_Shropshire helped to plant 8,000 trees near Clun, creating habitat, a #carbonstore & slowing the flow. These oaks replace conifers planted 50 years ago, despite the site being ancient woodland.
Funded by @EnvAgency, planted by Cashmore Contracting https://t.co/YfjkVxQoBI

We’ve started work to prevent river channel erosion near The Sloop Inn pub at Temple Hirst near #Selby. Rock armour is being used to strengthen the embankment. This is part of our £10m programme of repair works to defences following the #StormCiara floods. https://t.co/nZ2gsTbeBT

entity.name: Quarter-Final
entity.description: The Players Championship features the top 16 snooker players on the one-year ranking list. It's headed by World Number One Judd Trump, who defends the title he won so convincingly last season; beating Yan Bingtao 10-4 in the final. The tournament is the second of three that make up the Cazoo Series. Following the World Grand Prix in December, the Players Championship offers the chance to win valuable ranking points ahead of the series finale in March.

tweets.text:
Large number of complaints about foul odours across large parts of the Borough again this weekend. Both @EnvAgencyMids and @NewsNBC and @AaronBell4NUL are aware. 
Info about what can be done and how to report odours can be found here: https://t.co/T1SWLHYv5p

Had a great spring day out on the Mimram selecting trees to drop into the river to aid sediment sorting, fish cover and bed scour. Bees and scarlet elf caps, it's not all trout. @HMWTBadger @EnvAgency @WildTroutTrust https://t.co/DHGpvPNOau
@AndynBrown16 @Lancswildlife @LuntMeadows @EnvAgencyNW That's great but dredging all the rivers will reduce all flooding and protect the environment at the same time .Time for rethink for you guys !
@ProfJGrey @Riverflies @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyYNE @PeteTurnerEA @ilkleyIain @aireriverstrust @SandTCUKYorks @YorksWildlife What's the source of that? Farm drainage?

More hard work from @EnvAgency to repair the embankment at #LuntMeadows 🎉 Please don't visit the reserve while works are taking place as heavy plant machinery will be operating for the next few weeks. You can find out more here: https://t.co/R1NULAET8m https://t.co/gZigRCAGbU

Our Fields Teams have been closing penstocks on the River Aire Washlands. They were opened to let floodwater drain back to the river, after Storm Christophe. #beprepared https://t.co/pMgGs571SO https://t.co/EVbVYL8wr8

Very grateful for the reporter of this plastic barrier fencing, ‘ghost fishing,’ in the river Colne. Removed yesterday with no fish found trapped. @yourcolchester @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia @EssexWildlife @EssexSuffolkRT @Essex_CC @HighwaysSEAST @essex_kayakers #plastic #fish https://t.co/VADbz6HmfK

There are still #flood warnings and flood alerts in place across #Cumbria and heavy showers are expected this evening. 

Are you prepared? Check the latest situation in your area and sign up to our free flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/vVurIbgb6z

1/2 Leycesteria formosa is in our top 3 reported #species. The evidence you provide on #plants like this enables us to put these ornamentals for risk assessment to the non-native species secretariat. #gardening #spring #growyourown https://t.co/XgkwtexUGW

tweets.text: @stewart_mounsey @EnvAgencyNW Dose farms not come under businesses and homes ???

@whamsfarm Hi Neil - yes we remove gravel in places where it makes a real difference to reducing flood risk to homes and businesses -@EnvAgencyNW monitor 40 sites in #Cumbria and in 2020  removed (tonnes) - 10,000 #Kendal, 7300 #Keswick 500 #Braithwaite 160 #Glenridding https://t.co/bvQ66NiWmY

@whamsfarm @Lancswildlife @LuntMeadows @EnvAgencyNW Hi Neil. Yep we do dredging as part of routine maintenance. We do it where we have evidence it ⬇️ risk of flooding to homes & doesn’t make d/s risk worse.

Are you part of a flood group in #Devon, #Cornwall or the #IslesofScilly? 
Join our Community Hub and #BeFlood Ready: https://t.co/Fu3FfOlZwg

#FloodGroup #FloodResilience #BeFloodReady @DevComsTogether @EnvAgencySW @CwllCFloodForum https://t.co/dd9Wo1iLqk

Tucked in between, some delightful looking fish habitat mosaic: deeper scour pools, cover, pocket water, clean gravels for spawning & @Riverflies
Then, unsurprisingly, a source of chronic pollution from a small trib

#UpperAireProject https://t.co/g9uPGfxvy2
